result.execSummary:
The defendant Peter Benjamin Ross was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Flee Or Elude An Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: The Court granted Day Reporting Center and Huber privileges to be determined by the HOC staff.

miscConds.notes:
AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
Absolut sobriety.
Random urine screens at least 1 time per month.

DNA Sample.
Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.

No possession of controlled substances/alcohol without a valid prescription.
No possession of drug paraphernalia.
No contact with known illegal drug users/manufacturers/deliverers.
No possession of firearms/ammunition/magazines/body armor.
No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
Court will allow for expungement, upon  successful completion of probation.
Maintain full time/part time employment and/or education.
Notify agent of any/all prescriptions within 72 hours.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

timeConds.notes: Condition time, STAYED to be used at the discretion of agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Peter Benjamin Ross

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Peter Benjamin Ross in court.  Attorney Michael J Steinle in court for Peter Benjamin Ross.  Prosecuting attorney Dennis Patrick Murphy in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties prepared to proceed with sentencing. Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing. Additional statement made by Paul R.

AS TO COUNT 1:The Court ordered defendant to serve 3 MONTHS in the House of Correction, with credit for 8 days time served. The Court granted Day Reporting Center and Huber privileges to be determined by the HOC staff. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 12 MONTHS probation.

Conditions of Probation:
- 30 DAYS condition time, STAYED to be used at the discretion of agent.  
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute sobriety.
- DNA sample.
- No possession of controlled substances/alcohol without a valid prescription.
- Random urine screens at least 1 time per month.
- No possession of drug paraphernalia.
- No contact with known illegal drug users/manufacturers/deliverers.
- No possession of firearms/ammunition/magazines/body armor. 
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- Maintain fulltime/part time employment and/or education.
- Notify agent of any/all prescriptions within 72 hours.
- Court will allow for expungement, upon successful completion of probation.
- Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.

*Court advised defendant of appellant rights. 
*Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
*Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Received and filed: 
Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement

Defendant Peter Benjamin Ross in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for plea and sentencing.  Court grants defense request to amend the hearing to a plea hearing only and adjourn the sentencing hearing.
Parties have reached a resolution in this matter.
Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.
As to Count 1: 
Defendant changes his/her plea to GUILTY. Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may never possess a firearm, ammunition or body armor. Court advised defendant that his/her voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his/her civil rights are restored.
As to Count 2:  
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered count dismissed and read in.
Matter adjourned for sentencing hearing in Branch 25.   All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11, in Room 316 of the Safety Building.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Addendum to plea questionnaire, received and filed
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Peter Benjamin Ross in court with Attorney Michael J Steinle.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appear in person.
Defense counsel requests adjournment for plea and sentencing.
Case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 28.

Defendant Peter Benjamin Ross in court with Attorney Michael J Steinle; both appear by video.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 28.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
